author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Telugu
description: Lack of official Telugu content . Thus Telugu speakers cannot learn in their native language. There are 83 million speakers globally.

f6_assessments.q0: The Challenge aims to gather teams to “get the Cardano ball rolling in India,” with a goal of local-language websites and/or YouTube and social media to attract developers, and this project seems perfect for that. This has the potential to reach over 90 Million people, and may be a gateway for Cardano to set up local hubs in South India in many of the populated areas, including the megalopolis of Hyderabad, the 4th most populous city of India. With this Proposal’s aim being to make Catalyst and Cardano content and information available to those folks, this seems like a near-ideal way to bring developers into our ecosystem and, as the Campaign seeks, creating a buzz about Catalyst and promoting awareness. The Campaign also notes that there is a known large pool of IT talent and skills waiting to be tapped, and this Proposal mentions that South Asians are well suited for coding/developing, so it only seems natural that this project will have a powerful Impact exactly how Catalyst and Cardano are hoping for. Moreover, the inclusion of captioning/subtitles in transcriptions ensures that even Deaf members will be included, which is an added bonus for outreach/impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The steps of this Proposal seem logically broken down into realistically feasible bits and steps/phases, each quite actionable. It appears that teams to enact the plan are largely already ready to go to work, and that a network is readily available to address any hiccups. The four members of the listed team appear to have considerable experience doing this type of work, and even have an expert project manager, and as far as I can see nearly every step of the process has already been calculated and accounted for. Not only do all members have plenty of experience, but the numbers breakdown provided seems that this type of work would be a considerable bargain compared against commercially having this work done by others outside of the Catalyst proposal group. The budget mentions not charging for or needing to increase the budget if extra work is provided, suggesting that there may likely even be better output than the proposal itself implies. 

Each monthly goal seems practical and not overly ambitious, the per-day output of videos/work seems practical and not overly ambitious, and a well drawn/laid out plan seems ready to go. This project seems very feasible, ready to start, and pretty much only needs the Catalyst approval to become a reality.
f6_assessments.q2: The project lays out its milestones and KPIs quite well, and everything past the very beginning stages seems very well auditable. It specifies how many minutes to expect for each phase, and following subscribers, views, shares, etc. should be quite easy for any of us to check in on at any point. Not only are number of minutes of output video specified, but being able to check in on the amount of engagement with each video via things such as shares or view count now and eventually Catalyst engagement from the targeted community joining on should allow auditors to see how effective nearly all stages of this project have been even beyond just the duration of this project. Excellent auditability and KPI breakdown.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again

f6_assessments.q0: In this project they want to tackle the language problem for Telugu speakers. Making videos about the Cardano ecosystem in their native language also gives these people the opportunity to be better informed about the content. This project appeals to a target group of 83 million people. This project can certainly add value to the Cardano ecosystem as it will give 83 million Telugu speakers the opportunity to access the ecosystems. The main statistics are included in the proposal. It is good that they have already thought about how they will continue to work on this project in the future. The risks and challenges have been taken into account. It is good that in this proposal they already have solutions for the problems that may arise.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal clearly states who is member of the team. The team is made up of people with relevant experience and they form a good whole to ensure that the project runs smoothly. The team members are clearly defined and clearly have useful experience. The budget contains a clear description of the costs to be incurred. I think the budget is certainly sufficient. A realistic timetable is offered. The elaboration of this scheme could be a little more detailed. So it would be interesting to show the exact locations. The risks and challenges are well considered. It is good that solutions are already being offered in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A clear roadmap is included in the proposal stating what the team wants to achieve in the short term and in the long term. KPIs are clearly included and show whether this project succeeds or fails. Obviously, there is a language problem that prevents people who speak Telugu from accessing the Cardano ecosystem. By making the videos, people will have the opportunity to gain access. This solution will surely get this issue addressed.

f6_assessments.q0: Comprehension and communication is an indispensable trait for a rapidly expanding project such as Cardano, specially within majority developing-country areas of the world which are of the utmost importance for the mass adoption and spread of Cardano. For that to occur, the material must be available in the main languages of each region. India has the characteristics of a high inequality region, with a very large population, high percentage of people who don’t necessarily speak English or Hindi and high engagement with new technologies, and Telugu is spoken by approximately 90 million people in India, being one of the Top 5 most spoken local languages after Hindi, Bengali and Marathi, and also constituting a protected language in South Africa. This is a region ripe for disruption via the cryptoeconomy, and the use of Telugu to inform of Cardano-led projects will ensure a predominant market position for Cardano from an early stage.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is an active member of the Catalyst Community (General ADA holder in Catalyst Circle V3, Community Advisor in Fund 6 and 7, Veteran Community Advisor in Fund 7, Founder of South Asian Town Hall), and both he and potential collaborators have LinkedIn profile attached for verification of real/life track records, specially when it comes to translation skills and experience. This indicates a clear and deep commitment to the Cardano community and its success. The presence of EMURGO India could also provide the opportunity for some synergies to develop with funded proposals and subsequent informative material about Cardano in Telugu and/or other regional languages of India other than Hindi.
f6_assessments.q2: Within the budgetary breakdown provided, the milestones and KPIs (number of followers to the LanCardano Youtube Channel, average views per video, watching hours, comments, shares, downloads, etc.) for translating and publishing material in Telugu are clear and auditable, specially given the 1 video translated every 3 days goal, and the fact that the word-based budget includes translation, transcription, dubbing, editing, and publishing.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly identifies an issue within the challenge that may impact India and will add value. In this way the metrics and objectives are well aligned and the proposal can be expanded. Obviously it is a proposal that does not innovate and has already been worked on by other groups in other languages.These video translation strategies require a clear mechanism that allows their impact to be real.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is feasible, but the probability of its successful implementation is not entirely clear. The skills and experience are not fully supported, there is experience in translation, but there is no example that supports it, the number of team members is known. The budget is clearly described, however, I consider that this cost is not reasonable, because although the translation is useful, it is not guaranteed to have a number of followers and a marketing strategy is lacking. So I don't think the implementation plan is sensible. In this sense, the risks do not take into account the need to disclose and the impact of this.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for the achievement of the basic objective, however the way in which the metrics are impacted is not clear, given that we are talking about a campaign on social networks, but since you campaign on social networks is not clearly indicated. Then you have an idea but the strategy is not quite complete
f6_assessments.reply: This assessor has not considered the level of detail. He claims probability of implementation is not clear.  It is only 2 hours of video per month with a total budget of 7100 USD which is tiny. This doubt shows he is also part of the group of CAs who is against this project for other reasons than its own merits. That he has lumped it together with other projects and without any basis is condemending it even though we have said we have Master Translators for each project. He is therefore biased and should be filtered out

f6_assessments.q0:
The goal of  the “Cardano in Telugu” proposal is to translate Cardano related video content, from the IOHK YouTube channel into Telugu. The same team has submitted functionally identical proposals, each covering a different language, for 15 different languages of the Indian subcontinent. I would like to point out that in this case, this is not necessarily a problem as each proposal covers essentially a different service. The aim of each is to translate a YouTube video every 3 days, in this case into Telugu.

I have meticulously verified the text of all 15 proposals in a text editor that allows for snapshots and comparisons between snapshots (Scrivener), to make sure the text of the proposals is the same. With a few minor exceptions of paragraphs being present in some proposals, but not in others, I can say with confidence that they are functionally identical proposals. As such I will be reviewing the proposals as a proposal group.

Given India’s importance in the IT world, and especially considering its potential future growth my view is that this group of proposals would represent a very good investment for the Cardano community, and could have a great impact on attracting Indians to the ecosystem.

The main thing that I think is missing from this proposal group is the fact that they do not reference or acknowledge each other. If they did, the voters would get a much clearer picture of the project’s scope overall and be able to make much more informed decisions as a result. I would advise that in the future, if the proposals are to be resubmitted separately, the proposer should clearly indicate that the proposals are part of a proposal group and perhaps write a paragraph or two about the vision behind the project as a whole and how they plan to implement it, especially since the same people will be responsible for the project management, logistics and implementation of the whole set of proposals.

I can understand the reasoning behind submitting each language translation as a new proposal, so that the Cardano community can choose to fund as many as they think is necessary, and that the project can still go ahead if only a few languages are funded. However, I also feel that the average voter, who may only come across 2-3 proposals should have been made aware of the existence of the proposal group. 

The proposers provide the number of speakers for each language in each category, however as the proposals do not reference each other I will make a list of all languages the proposers have submitted proposals for, in order of the number of worldwide speakers:

	1)	Hindi - 528 million speakers globally
	2)	Urdu - 280 million speakers globally
	3)	Bengali - 250 million speakers globally
	4)	Punjabi - 113 million speakers globally
	5)	Marathi - 83 million speakers globally
	6)	Telugu - 83 million speakers globally (this proposal)
	7)	Gujarati - 75 million speakers globally
	8)	Tamil - 75 million speakers globally
	9)	Kannada - 56 million speakers globally
	10)	Bhojpuri - 51 million speakers globally
	11)	Odia - 39 million speakers globally
	12)	Malayalam - 39 million speakers globally
	13)	Nepali - 25 million speakers globally
	14)	Sinhala - 25 million speakers globally
	15)	Assamese - 24 million speakers globally

I have cross-checked these figures with the information provided in the Languages of India Wikipedia article https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Languages_of_India , and for the most part they check out. There are a few small discrepancies, but that is perfectly understandable given the dataset, even the Wikipedia article feature 2 separate lists with slightly varying numbers. Not on the lists in the article are Nepali (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepali_language) and Sinhala (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinhala_language).

I have also compiled a list of links to all the proposals in the group for easier reference:

	•	Cardano in Hindi - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398838 
	•	Cardano in Urdu - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398847 
	•	Cardano in Bengali - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398841 
	•	Cardano in Punjabi - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398857 
	•	Cardano in Marathi -  https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398842 
	•	Cardano in Telugu (this proposal) - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398843  
	•	Cardano in Gujarati - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398845 
	•	Cardano in Tamil - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398840 
	•	Cardano in Kannada - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398850 
	•	Cardano in Bhojpuri - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398981 
	•	Cardano in Odia - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398853 
	•	Malayalam - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398856 
	•	Cardano in Nepali - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398858 
	•	Cardano in Sinhala - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/404484 
	•	Cardano in Assamese - https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398980 

There are a few inconsistencies, meaning the authors failed to update each proposal with the correct language, or, in a few instances, the number of speakers internationally is not consistent within a proposal, however, that is understandable given the number of proposals they had to keep track off.

Overall, even though the proposal itself could definitely use some more work and could have been better written and more refined in a number of areas, the initiative itself is worthwhile and it’s a big plus for the Cardano translation effort that we have access in our community to such well-connected individuals in the translation field that are offering their services at very competitive rates.

The budget for translating a single language is very reasonable at $7,100, however, all the languages combined add up to almost 3 quarters of the total category budget, $106,500 out of $150,000. While the initiative to make Cardano content accessible in various Indian languages is certainly worthwhile it is up to the Cardano community to decide which to prioritise and fund and hopefully this overview will assist with that.
f6_assessments.q1:
Similarly mentioned in the Impact and Auditability sections of my assessment of this proposal, “Cardano in Telugu” is part of a group of proposals that aim to translate IOHK YouTube content into 15 Indian languages. As the proposals are functionally identical, my reviews will also be almost the same. However, reviewing a group of 15 proposals took almost the same amount of time as assessing 15 unique proposals, because of the steps described in the Impact section of my assessment. 

The roadmap is very detailed and easy to follow. It makes perfect sense for the projects.

The budget requested by the team is very reasonable and a portion of it, $2000 out of $7100 is set aside for contingencies, meaning that even if unforeseen situations were to happen the team should be able to deal with them and deliver the product.

All the 15 proposals promise to “Translate the entire content of IOHK in stages”, however since that is a monumental task I would have liked to see more indications about their plan of action, and what they plan to start with. The proposals mention applying for future Catalyst funding	 if the project is to continue. 

Since the proposals’ primary focus is translating YouTube videos from the IOG channel, I would advise contacting them and coordinating with IOG on this effort. Especially if multiple proposals will be funded.

This could result in multiple benefits. For instance, the proposals don’t specify how the translations are to be handled, if they intend to bake them in, hardcode them in the videos, or if they are to be presented as CC (close captions).
If the translations are baked in, it would make sense for IOG to provide them with the original video files. This way the team won’t have to download the highly compressed video file from YouTube and upload a video file that has gone through multiple compressions, greatly reducing quality.
IOG could get access to the text of the translations to be included in its primary videos, if wished, as CC (close captions).

The description of the team members involved with this project is very detailed and they seem more than competent to get the job done. The included LinkedIn profile links were helpful, however the LinkedIn profiles were kind of sparse for some of the team members. But, that didn’t constitute a problem since enough info is given in the proposals themselves.

The roles that the team members mentioned in the proposal will take within the projects are not exactly specified. However, I assume they will be mostly responsible for the project management of the proposals and the translations will be handled by the “Master Translators” mentioned several times in the proposal. If this is the case, I would have liked to see more details around this and how they plan to recruit. However, given the stated experience of the proposals my level of confidence that they will get the job done is high.

I particularly appreciated that, unlike many other proposers, the team behind this proposal has taken the time to properly identify and address a long list of risks/problems that could occur during the translation process. This definitely increases the feasibility of the proposals.
f6_assessments.q2:
Also indicated in the Impact and Feasibility sections of the review for this proposal, “Cardano in Telugu”, is just one in a group of 15 proposals that aim to translate IOHK YouTube content into 15 Indian languages. Telugu, in the case of this proposal.

Given that translated YouTube videos are the main deliverables to track for this group of 15 proposals the metrics presented in the auditability section should be sufficient to verify the evolution of the projects as they all have to do with engagement on the platform.

 As the output of these projects is YouTube videos, the quality of the translations will only be able to be verified by speakers of the 15 languages which the projects aim to produce translations for, but that is beyond the scope of current Catalyst auditability requirements. 

The definitions of success given are more or less a copy/paste of the metrics presented in the initial section of the Auditability part of the proposals and various other parts of the proposal. However, the initial paragraph does offer some info about what the team hopes to accomplish with this overarching project that spans 15 Catalyst proposals in this round.
In the future, I would definitely recommend giving more thought to this section of the proposals and rewriting it. For instance, attaching clear values to each of the metrics given would have turned them into milestones/goals; an example: “15000 average views per video”. But, ultimately this doesn’t carry much weight in this case, given the nature of the project and the set of proposals.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers provide a great idea to bring Cardano closer to the population of more than 83 million Telugu speaking people in India. This proposal falls within the challenge setting purpose because it will help to grow the awareness of Telugu speaking people in India about Cardano. The total number of translation duration of 120 minutes per month seems limited for someone who would like to discover about blockchain and Cardano. If the translation duration can be increased, it would be more attractive. The idea can also be scaled up easily by translating to Telugu more Cardano and blockchain's videos and other channels such as the Emurgo and Cardano Foundation Youtube channel. Furthermore, some risks are identified correctly and reasonable mitigation solutions for those risks have been provided, enhancing the chance of project success. In conclusion, with all above-mentioned information, I agree that the proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The founder team intends to upload one video every three days. This would sound more feasible if the duration of the video is roughly provided. Proposal roadmap is clear and straight forward. It means 120 minutes of translated video per month. For a person who would like to discover more about blockchain and Cardano, such duration seems too small. If the proposers can increase the duration of translated video, it would have greater impact on the Telugu community. Besides, the founder team comprises of masters of translation with clear reference links about their information for audience to assess at any time. In addition, the requested budget is broken down into assessable details and sounds reasonable. The total requested budget for the project of 7100$ is reasonable. In summary, it is highly likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully by the founder team.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap of the proposal is presented clearly since it is quite straightforward. Measurements of success is also briefly defined. If the metrics for success is measurably  defined, it would be much easier for audit later on. For example: The proposal defines the metrics are: Number of followers to the Lan Cardano Youtube Channel; Number of average views per video; Number of watching hours; Number of comments; Number of shares; Number of downloads; the questions are: How many numbers of followers to the Lan Cardano Youtube Channel would the project be classified as success? How many numbers of average views per video would the project be classified as success? How many numbers of watching hours would the project be classified as success? How many numbers of comments would the project be classified as success? How many numbers of shares would the project be classified as success? How many numbers of download would the project be classified as success? This is the first time this proposal has been submitted to Catalyst for funding. In summary, with all presented arguments, I believe that the proposal is auditable in term of both progress and success.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project, there will be similar sentences"). This proposal is intended to help Telugu people understand Cardano, but the difficulty here is that Telugu people can't learn their language, so the author has provided videos translated in Marathi to help the people here. understand Cardano and the ecosystem it runs on. The purpose of this proposal is to overcome the ignorance of the people here to create a trusted platform for the 83 million Telugu people to deeply understand the ecosystem as well as Blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies. The idea is great. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge... The author has proposed a well-defined, goal-directed problem-solving approach that offers a lasting solution, a defined path. clearly defined problem solving. . . The author scales with future challenges and the Telugu community on the Cardano ecosystem, blockchain basics help everyone here build better apps. Build a community of players in Telugu. They also outline possible risks, there are also some risk solutions highlighting the challenge by looking at it from a legal perspective. This shows that the author is very cautious with the progress of their project.
f6_assessments.q1: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project there will be similar sentences"). It is proposed to specify a clear period for activities to be divided into 3 months. The author has a team fluent in all languages ​​with more than 20 years in the industry. I believe the project's roadmap will be on schedule as the author promised. The budget is 7.100 USD, detailed and listed by the author for each category. With the amount listed for each month, I find the budget sufficient to check the progress of the proposal. Suggest an easy way to measure success through the metrics the author has listed. . . It is surprising with the number of years of experience that the group has given, the 4-member group has more than 20 years of experience. I do not doubt the experience of the propagandists, they are all elite members, members that we can follow through social networking sites. With a solid team of experts with good leadership, based on the information provided I think this project will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project there will be similar sentences"). The measurement indicators are detailed by the author in 3 months of implementation, each month will produce 120 minutes of video. Well-defined KPIs determine the success of the proposal through the number of views, several followers, shares... The author gives great ideas it tackles effectively the challenge, if it is funded I believe the project will be very successful it will have a good impact on making more people aware of Cardano. However, the success of this project is tied to the success of other projects so I think the risk will be multiplied. . . This project is completely new and is waiting for funding.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The impact is good, but there are problems here, so my opinion on this part of the proposal is neutral. As soon as I started reading this proposal I noticed a dissonance. In the title, it is said that there would be translations of content that addressed Cardano into Telugu, but during the impact, right at the beginning of the explanations, in the part of solutions to the problem, the proponent cites another language: “provide videos translated into Tamil educating the Tamil community in India and internationally about Cardano and its ecosystem (...)”. After all, in which language will the translations be generated? Perhaps the bidder got confused when writing the proposal, as, from what I can see, India contains several different languages ​​being spoken by its natives, and this same bidder has launched several proposals to translate some youtube videos into different of these languages. Anyway, I will consider that this proposal will work on top of the Telugu translations, but it would be important for the proposer to review this proposal and fix the error. Now talking about the impact of the proposal, I think the idea is good and it aligns well with the objectives of the challenge. There would be translations of videos from famous and important youtube channels that talk about Cardano, such as the “IOHK channel, as well as content from the Youtube channels of Emurgo and Cardano Foundation”. It would be important for us to know exactly what content would be published here, within the various options provided by these channels. I think the ideal for us to understand the impact in a specific way is to list how many videos would be translated and which ones, in order of release. Of course, they would start with more introductory topics such as what is blockchain, what are cryptocurrencies, what is Cardano and so on, and then move on to an in-depth approach to the topics. But to improve our understanding, the ideal would be that the proponent actually made available which videos would be translated, that he attached the respective links in the description of the impact. I would also like to know which other channels would be chosen for the videos to be translated, because this would increase confidence that the information provided would be factual, safe and correspond to the truth about how our ecosystem is constituted. In other words, we would have more confidence in what was to come. Ultimately, I think so, the proposal aligns with the goals of making Cardano more accessible to the inhabitants of India, as the language barrier would be broken down, and this would make it easier for them to become active members of the Cardano community, either through participation in Catalyst, working as programmers, designers or advertisers for any of our funded projects, etc. And, obviously, this would benefit the blockchain itself, as it would popularize it in India, causing the number of adherents and investors to grow as a whole. I think the things that need to be addressed are the confusion as to which language the translations will be made into and providing more detail on what exact subjects translated and where that content would be fetched from (apart from the cited channels).
f6_assessments.q1: Starting with the script analysis, we are told what would happen in the first 3 months of the project. As I understand it, the project would have this duration as a total. I think the past information about the months is basically the same and is not properly fleshed out. In the first month, the channel would be launched, with translated and dubbed videos, resulting in a total duration of 360 minutes. And in the other two months, what would happen would be the continuation of content production, with the goal always around 360 minutes, as well as publicity campaigns on social networks. What would need to be done in my opinion, to improve this script, is that each month was divided into weeks and that we had an individual explanation of what would happen in each of them. Would it be necessary for the activities to be detailed in more depth, for example, how would the team be assembled? What would the work routine be like for the translations to be done? What would this social media outreach campaign look like? Which social networks would be focused, and why? And how would the content be transmitted? Would it be through illustrations, videos, texts? There is a lack of detail when it comes to understanding how everything will be organized. Now talking about the budget, the asking amount is 7100 dollars. The value of the translations themselves is calculated in words resulting in a total of 1200 dollars per month. I find it difficult to keep track of whether the promised amount of words has actually been translated, so in my opinion it would be better if this price was calculated according to the length of time. For example, 1 minute translated would be X value. That way, it would be much simpler for us, in the auditability part, to check if the requested value was used correctly. Other parts of the funding should also be better explained, in my opinion, such as the 1500,000 requests for campaigns on social media. We know that it is essential for any project to have strong publicity, but as I explained in the detailing part of the script, this campaign is not detailed, it is not explained, so we cannot justify whether the amount asked for this part is fair or not. All parts of the budget should be well argued. And finally, about the team, this part of the project is very good, a good detail is presented about each member of the team, we know their names, their professional resumes, whatever, what they have done so far, and we also have links to social networks through which we can verify the said information. Therefore, in terms of feasibility, only 1 of the three topics is satisfactorily detailed, so I suggest that the others be equally in-depth.
f6_assessments.q2: The bidder provides a means of auditing the bid, both in terms of the process and the final results. As it is a project that lasts three months, my suggestion is that at the end of each month a final report is made available that contains links to all the videos that were translated and also a small summary of how the team worked in that period of time. : if everything that was planned was done, both in the production of translation and in the dissemination of the content, if something was pending for the next month, if any difficulties were faced, etc. I think that this way, we would have a more complete understanding of the development process, beyond the posting of the videos itself (which is the most important thing, of course, but not the only thing to follow during the 3 months). And in terms of the final results, I would like more qualitative data to be analyzed in addition to the numerical statistics provided by the proponent. It is extremely important that we know the number of followers on the channel, the number of hours viewed, etc., because these quantities will objectively demonstrate the scope of this project. But beyond that, we would need to understand if the people who watched the translated videos were understanding well, if they actually became active members of the community, if they created digital wallets, acquired Ada, etc. This data could be collected through a direct survey with the channel's consumers, and the results of this survey would need to be made known to the Cardano community. This bridge can be established in several different ways, such as through more written forms, or through a video meeting between the team and some channel subscribers, who feel engaged in helping to understand the impact of this project, this meeting could be done in some post Town Hall room, recorded and posted on their own channel, of course, if all participants allowed it. In summary, I think the auditability is good, but it can improve in some points, mainly due to a more humane approach to the final results.
f6_assessments.reply:
THese projects are not intended to build Devs. they are intended for 99% of the population who are non devs to onboard to Cardano as well, hold some ada, learn how to invest, how to increase their holdings in qty and value, and get used to a crypto economy.  

DOes the community not understand simple KPIs?  We are not artists to be able to do visual documents.  We stand by our process, our KPIs and metrics. We have done this for 25 years we know what we are doing. How would the community access those results? Just like they access the results in every one elses projects!!! The proposer provides them the results.

f6_assessments.q0: Please note this assessment should be taken in context of a set of 19 similar proposals by the same proposer in two challenges, Grow India, Grow Cardano and Grow The only real difference between the proposals being the spoken language used (Urdu, Thai, Gujurati, Laotian, etc.). In all other respects they are essential the same. Hence it is almost impossible to write 19 distinct assessments, I have tried to find specific differentiators but have also looked at the package of proposals as a whole as, I believe, this will add greater value to the voter. Looking at this specific proposal for translating videos into Telegu, it largely meets the challenge brief in seeking to broaden the horizons of the Cardano ecosystem. The proposer should be praised for taking the initiative. I would suggest the proposer uses the comments section to explain voters their rationale behind this multi-proposal approach. That should help with transparency and help people make an informed decision. For example: Are they looking for voters to decide on which languages they prefer thus restricting the choice to the existing community. This kind of defeats the purpose of reaching out to new communities. If this is the case I have done a rudimentary research on number of people speaking each language to help the voters make an informed decision. Given more time, an in depth analysis of demographics would be useful showing current literacy levels, access to technology, levels of education, English speakers, etc in India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka. Telegu ranks 6th so a good contender? 1.Hindi:615M 2.Bengali:265M 3.Urdu:170M 4.Punjabi:126M 5.Marathi:95M 6.Telugu:93M 7.Tamil:81M 8.Gujarati:61M 9.Kannada:56M 10.Bhojpuri:50M 11.Odia:38M 12.Malayalam:38M 13.Sinhala:17M 14.Nepali :17M 15.Assamese:15M Where the voter needs to pay particular attention is the entirety of the ask. The proposal therefore under assessment are: Grow India, Grow Cardano - 15 Proposals https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/404484 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398981 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398980 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398858 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398857 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398856 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398853 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398850 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398847 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398845 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398843 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398842 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398841 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398840 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398838
f6_assessments.q1: The contents of feasibility are duplicated across all 19 proposals. In simple terms we are looking at a total ask of $135,900 of which $38,000 (28%) is contingency. At a proposal level that is $7100 budget with $2000 contingency. My project planning head immediately points to the 28% contingency. It is not clear what this is set aside for. A risk of ADA price fluctuation is noted in the proposals, however one of the proposed mitigations for that is a 10% contingency, the other being to sell funds privately to ADA holders. In addition the proposals states “We have ample resources to complete the project on time and within budget’, once again raising the question on the need for such a large contingency in proportion to the budget? Now looking at what is to be delivered. Each proposal states the YouTube channel will be launched with 6 videos. We have to assume that means 6 videos translated in all 19 languages should they all be funded. After 3 months 10-20 videos (each translated in 19 languages) That gives us 380 translations in total at an average of 4 per day. I have run this by someone with experience in this area and their reaction was ‘its going to need a considerable team’. So, let’s look at the evidence of a team with the skills to deliver this proposal. The proposer claims to have many years experience in this field but this is impossible to verify based on the evidence (LinkedIn profile) provided. The other key resource (Muthiah) presents as a trilingual translator. Specific languages are not mentioned so very difficult to validate of if they have the skills for this specific proposal Two other individuals are listed, their LinkedIn in profile are well populated but don’t display the skills required to deliver this project. That leave us with the “extensive network of Master translators”. Again no evidence of their existence of previous work exists so impossible to evaluate. I believe the proposer has a lot to offer the ecosystem and can suggest the following: 1. Help the voter understand the need for 19 similar proposals 2. Provide evidence that they have access to the skills required 3. Look at a small scope with a set of languages he or Muthiah are comfortable with. Use this as a POC on both the translation and engagement side. SHOW the community this proposal is growing adoption. 4. Take the learnings (e.g. which types of video are interesting your audience) and if a larger (multi language) proposal is what is required submit it in a future fund leveraging in the economies of scale that will naturally provide on the maintenance of socials, contingency & marketing.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are sensible in terms of measuring engagement on youtube which is a great basic piece to measure. However to really get to the crux of the challenge we need to see the conversion rates into Cardano and/or Catalyst • increased interaction between Catalyst and Indian focused projects • Number of Indian focused Catalyst submissions • Number of Indian focused dapps/services actually built
f6_assessments.reply:
This has to be filtered out.  So many reasons..
Combining into one proposal may make sense to this proposer who may not be from Asia and recognize the huge diversity from state to state or region to region. All languages cannot be done by same people or same social media campaign.  This is why we broke up. Smaller proposals enable people to clearly see we are not here to grab money.   Each language needs its unique Social media campaign to reach people.  We cannot lump everything into one.   

Secondly Why consider the total ask?  The rules state that each proposal has to be considered on its own merit.  Therefore even if  i had a hundred language proposals, if i had a hundred teams of two Master Translators and Two Proofreaders, then it will get the job done. We are doing this for 25 years buddy.   We know exactly how to run a translation project.



He goes on
The proposer claims to have many years experience in this field but this is impossible to verify based on the evidence (LinkedIn profile) provided. The other key resource (Muthiah) presents as a trilingual translator.
I have stated as below, we have and use our extensive network of Master Translator Partners.

The assessor has not read the proposal. It states clearly as follows
The number of people required to complete this task has been calculated.  
We will be using our inhouse resources as well as obtain our Master Translator Partner network to handle overflow of work to ensure that our deliverables remain on track. They would be brought on board as and when needed and budget would include their costs

I can see clearly that this assessor is merely following the wrong ideas of some CAs to say that the feasibility is not good because they believe I alone  is doing Or Mr Muthiah D is doing,  the translations or this internal team is doing the translation of all the 10 languages.  This is completely WRONG.  As mentioned above we are using our External partners who are Master Translators with many years of experience and qualifications in translating as Native speakers of Tamil both in Sri Lanka and India. So his feasibility assessment is wrong. 

How the budget was calculated has been clearly laid out as follows.. if he claims he has read the other proposals he will know that we are doing 15000 words per project. Each word costs 0.08 for complete translation to voicing. This cost comes to 1200 and into 3 months it is 3600.  Then this language needs its own Social media campaign since the users of one language would not care about social media campaigns in another language. So all languages cannot be lumped together to do one campaign.  The cost of that being 1500..  Then for contingency we have allocated 2000.    
Some specific statements that are absolute nonsense=
However, because the primary responsibility of this position is to translate text from English to Tamil, the proposer should include more specific information on their translators' expertise in their Master Translator Partner Network.   As stated we have been doing projects for over 25 years. The definition of Master translator if this assessor doesn't understand is a MASTER OF HIS CRAFT.  A SENIOR IN THE INDUSTRY.   Each one will have different qualifications.  As for our specific master translator, he is the ONLY ONE IN SRI LANKA to write for the Mahawamsa which is like the BIBLE OF HISTORY of SRI LANKA for over 4000 years. It has been written from the time of kings.  This is a role that he alone in Sri Lanka has. So this assessor is talking nonsense
Please filter him out.

f6_assessments.q0: It is definitely that  this proposal can bring huge advantage to Cadano system, in the first part, the plans are presented very obviously and well-organized. The provided solutions are definitely solving the problem as it provides various kind of transcribed materials such as videos, contents, with subtitle. One more thing, the project can help to increase community for ecosystem so it can meet the challenge. The key metrics are suitable with the aim of proposal. The project has some risks but the ways to deal with the risks are provided, this can be another advantage of the proposal. In general, the key metrics can match with the challenge of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: As can be seen that the detailed plan is prepared carefully so that is easy for the reader to follow, how to launch the Chanel is presented in the detailed time. It reveals that the writer put a lot of effort into the proposal. The road maps are sufficient and detailed but it could be better if the proposed plan after 3 months or reveal a little bit about the long-term plan. It doesn’t matter if it is not provided but it could be taken into consideration. The budget is written almost with the purposes, and it is divided into small numbers, but some of them are still quite general such as Social Media Campaign and Contingency Fee. It could be better if they are as detailed as the others. The team members are so professional that they obviously meet the employees’ requirements of the proposal. Contacts are mentioned but if there is any evidence such as certificate or anything related to their experience, it could be additional good point.
f6_assessments.q2: The way to measure the progress of the project is reasonable, but it could be more valuable if more tools or evidence provided. The roadmap is repeated twice so it can be shortening to avoid redundant.  The key metrics are suitable but could be more detailed with the expected number so the reader can probably know more about your progress. Instead, the goals are performed so clear and organized with the suitable and detailed steps. Last but not least, the information about the proposal this proposal is a continuation of a previously funded project or it is a new project is now missing, it can be clarified if necessary.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solution is divided into main ideas such as defining the problem, describing the solution, and the impact, and this makes it easier for me to follow and easy to understand the content that the author wants to convey. The lack of Tamil content has caused a lot of big obstacles for this community. Because of this, this proposal offers a number of solutions such as translating videos to educate the community about the Cardano ecosystem or IOHK content and will be transcribed and subtitled for the hearing impaired. And that will help increase the number of people to join Cardano and have a new community to help develop and enrich Cardano as well as Blockchain technology and cryptocurrency... In addition, the writer also provides an additional positive impact for the community, especially in the field of information technology and computer science, the metric is specifically stated and aligns with the challenge. The challenge that the project is facing is mainly caused by the epidemic that makes interpreters may not be able to do it, I think it will be difficult to find interpreters with a language that is not popular. but they are always ready with an alternative plan. So this makes me see that the people in the project are always ready for even the worst-case scenario. In addition, the problems of ADA price volatility have also been found to be solved by having an additional reserve of about 10% of the total cost or finding a more reliable network. Because it clearly presents risks and alternatives, I highly evaluate this project.
f6_assessments.q1: In the part,, the roadmap is made very specific and detailed, each stage is divided into specific times and tasks to be performed and the results obtained after each stage. The team on this project is also full of impressive members who are experts in many fields, and their experience makes the project more reliable like Dimitri Fernando voiced and produced many shows in Sri Lanka and other related works. there's also Muttiah Duraiswamy. He's an Official Language translator.. so there's no doubt about the quality of the translations. Software expert Rishantha Welikadage can take care of setting up a blockchain-based system for rapid integration of new languages to bring more than 100 languages of the world to the Cardano blockchain. And many other core members are necessary for the activities in the roadmap.
f6_assessments.q2: The success nd development of the project is based on the roadmap and specific presentation, so it is easy for me to follow, but the key metrics items do not have specific numbers to easily evaluate whether or not this proposal succeeded. So to be more convincing, I think the proposer should estimate specific numbers to evaluate the development and success of the proposal, and the writer should also describe more clearly the characteristics to define a  completed goal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The project has the ability to significantly increase Telugu speakers' awareness of the Cardano ecosystem by offering translated videos. 

The proposal gives statistics on the number of Telugu speakers, but I believe the proposal could also include further analysis on the degree of blockchain comprehension of Telugu speakers. If there is a lack of awareness of blockchain technology, generating blockchain tutorials should be prioritized before creating information regarding the Cardano environment. This will make better impact on the community.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer provides practical data on the number of translated videos uploaded each month, as well as the length of the videos. A well-defined timetable and output are prescribed. I'd want to know more about the specific content of each video in order to properly evaluate whether or not the audience will gain appropriate fundamental understanding of Cardano ecosystem. The information about team members is clear and trustworthy, with LinkedIn profiles attached; the team as a whole has extensive expertise in both Cardano and translation. However, there is no information on the marketing campaign to attract audience.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposer provides a detailed roadmap with specific milestones for better progress tracking. About KPIs and metrics, the number of comments is a good metric but sometimes misunderstanding in case all of the comments are negative. 
Some metrics I would recommend adding: 
- The ratio between positive and negative comments/feedback from audience. 
- The view rate between videos (increasing/decreasing).

f6_assessments.q0: India is a diverse country and has a lot of languages throughout the countries. In order to effectively market or spread the knowledge on Cardano to all the people of the country, translation of the content of Cardona to local language is required and is the most effective way to reach a larger group of people. In this case, the local language would be Telugu, which is very huge community in the south and they are very proud of the language. Hence translating the contents of Cardano in Telugu would reach a lot more people than expected and also be appreciated for translating into Telugu. Many of the people in India are educated in their local language and might face difficulties in English, by translating the content to Telugu it would benefit a lot of people in getting familiar with Cardano and also the advancements of it. The proposer has effectively addressed the challenge and I strongly believe this application will be a success to Cardano as it will be reach more people and more people will be knowledgeable through this with the comfort of learning in their own language. It is also a scalable project and could go global benefiting Cardona on a large scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a roadmap on how to implement the project as he has mentioned that he will be uploading a new video every 3 days in the Telugu language and hence by uploading the Cardona content in the Telugu language on a regular interval of time would attract more viewers and gain more subscribers. It would also be helping a lot of people educate about Cardano in a better way. This whole together will be indeed bringing a new community to the Cardona, once someone sees the content in Telugu they will be more likely to promote the videos on their own to friends and family to watch them and it will be of a better reach. The experience of proposer and his team seems to be very impressive and the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has requested 7100 USD as funds to implement this project and he has also provided the breakup cost that will be spent on each individual requirement which seems fair. The proposer has also projected the funds for next 3 months and the money requested will be sufficient to audit the progress. The proposal is most likely to succeed as it going to reach over a community of 83 million Telugu speaking individuals. It will be very useful in reaching Cardona into the Indian market by translating the content into regional languages and the reach will be more than expected in the future days. The proposer has also foreseen the difficulties they might face while implementation and also has alternative solutions for the same.

f6_assessments.q0:
👉NOTE! Because of the similarity content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Cardano in ' submitted by Dimitri Fernando might look similar. I wrote this after spending more than 10 hours reading. This was not copied from anyone.👈 

This proposal request 7.100$ to translate the entire content of IOHK into Telugu, and create videos with a total length of 360 minutes in 3 months in about 3 months, then upload it on his YouTube channel to educate Telugu in Srilanka and around the world.  

I agree that India is the 2nd most populous country in the world and has many different languages in many different localities. We should have a Telugu Community Center for Hindi speakers. Building a YouTube channel with materials from IOHK and the Cardano Foundation translated into Telugu is the first step to helping Cardano outreach to Telugu speakers.  

For the risks, the Illness, and the fall down of ADA prices are the main potential risks. The proposer had introduced a solution to solve them. Besides, in my thought, Mr. Dimitri and his team need to consider the acceptance of their Telugu translations by the Telugu speakers, because there is no one in the Team who speaks Telugu. Often, people are more easily accepting of information from people who speak their native language than from people who speak Telugu as a second language.  

For those reasons, I rate 4 stars for the Impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
👉NOTE! Because of the similar content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Cardano in ' submitted by Dimitri Fernando might look similar. I wrote this after spending more than 10 hours reading. This was not copied from anyone.👈 

Timeline for the tasks within 3 months. However, as my experience in translating and producing Cardano videos, the number of IOHK documents has produced more than 15,000 different documents. It was a huge amount of work to do that the word “entire” did not fit into a proposal within 3 months. Instead, a priority list of topics for translation would be more feasible. 

The budget was broken down into Translate, Marketing, and Contingencies of fall down ADA price.  In the team, except for Dimitri, there are 3 other people who have decades of experience in translation. In addition, they can expand up to hundreds of people in the community of translators with which they are working together. However, it would be better if we could see the translation products that you have done. Because the documents from Cardano, IOHK are almost technical knowledge, it is difficult for translators who have not prepared professional knowledge to make its meaning closer. This happened to me while running my translation team. 

And the last, who will take the obligation to translate into Telugu, and who will audit his/her translation? It is better if there is a translator who was born and growth in India and spoke in Telugu.  

For those reasons, I rate 2 stars for the Feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
👉NOTE! Because of the similar content in the proposals, my assessments and rating for the proposals started with: 'Cardano in ' submitted by Dimitri Fernando might look similar. I wrote this after spending more than 10 hours reading. This was not copied from anyone.👈 

The given metrics to measure is acceptable. And the success of the project Cardano in Telugu after 3 months is very obvious. But, it is better if you show a sample product. A video of an IOHK document that was translated into Telugu might help the community visualize your success. 

Because this is your first time submitting a proposal, I suggest you should submit only 1 or 2 proposals for testing, you will have something to convince the community. You can start with the Telugu community. In addition, we also want to know how your team can manage more than 30 different projects if all your projects are funded. 

For those reasons, I rate 2 stars for the Auditability.
